result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua G Geyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. May have contact with Briana with approval of the Probation Agent.  
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on Tuesday, November 2, 2016, to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Court grants work release. Court grants 1 day credit to be applied towards the 60 day jail sentence.

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Joshua G Geyman in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Argument by State.  Argument by Attorney Petros.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 1 year Probation - Must report to Probation by Tuesday, November 1, 2016
60 days jail - Must report to jail on Wednesday, November 2, 2016 by 10:00 AM - Work release granted - Credit for 1 day
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
May have contact with Brianna with approval of Probation Agent
Court costs including DNA surcharge

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.  Must report to Barron County Jail on Wednesday, November 2, 2016, to submit DNA sample.

Bond continues until he reports to jail.

Jail faxed

Defendant Joshua G Geyman in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PLQ filed. Plea agreement;
Defendant pleads guilty to Count 3  -  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Factual basis found.  
Count 1  is Dismissed and Read In.

PSI ordered -   Must report to Department of Corrections by Thursday  8-25-2016 by 3:00 pm.

Both sides will be free to argue.
